article: If a sitcom that lasts for l0 years is considered popular , then surely one that still arouses emotions after 20 must be considered a classic . Friends first aired in the US in 1994 , featuring a cast of six young men and women in New York . In the time since , it ' s become one of the most famous titles in the sitcom style , aired in over 100 countries and regions in the world . The show is typical among those who grew up in the 1990s because it explores basic yet important themes like friendship , struggling to survive in a big city , and finding independence and identity , all of which are still relevant to young audiences today . Against the background of the Internet age , IT staff who were once marginalized and laughed at have experienced a revival due to the popularity of hit show The Big Bang Theory , in which four talents lacking normal social skills make an attempt at living on a college campus . At the same time , Gossip Girl , describing a young cast of New Yorkers born with silver spoons in their mouths , demonstrates the difficulties upper - class adolescents experience . The show ' s fashion and mature subject matter allowed it to capture the interest of both teenagers and adults . Although these typical TV shows span a wide timeline and feature a variety of themes , they all have a universal topic . Love , money , friendship , career aspirations and identity are things all young people struggle to understand . Why are they still fascinating ? It remains to be found out .
questions: Why is the sitcom Friends typical among young people in the 1990s ?

model: because the shows are all about teenagers ' life .
because it addresses the subjects faced by the youth .
human: Because it predicts the future of the young at that time .
Because it addresses the subjects faced by the youth .
